meanings.definition: A hypothetical prehistoric language from which modern languages are believed to have evolved.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study protolanguage to understand how languages changed over time.
meanings.sent2: Linguists use protolanguage to trace the origins of different language families.
meanings.sent3: The idea of protolanguage traveling through time sounds like a fascinating journey.
meanings.sent4: Protolanguage is like a seed from which the tree of modern languages grew.
meanings.sent5: Imagining protolanguage as a puzzle helps unravel the mysteries of language evolution.

meanings.definition: The reconstructed or hypothetical parent language from which a group of related languages developed.
meanings.sent1: Scholars compare words in different languages to uncover the roots of protolanguage.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use protolanguage to connect the dots between diverse language groups.
meanings.sent3: Thinking about protolanguage as a family reunion of languages is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Protolanguage acts as a bridge linking various languages across time and space.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing protolanguage as a fountainhead helps grasp its significance in linguistic history.
